body: It is only the necessary framework files that takes up 2.4 mb. and only needs to be downloaded once until a new version of the framework is out. So once the browser have downloaded those files (could be from another blazor website) then your website does not require that download.

Thanks for your answer. Seems like I was a bit confused... But the DLLs are still not human-readable like javascript, so they would still serve the same purpose. And yes, file size is a concern. This may be a little off topic, but do you know of another technology that would be able to do this, with a smaller footprint?
